content.question: Firm <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Z</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is producing <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> widgets using labor and capital. The marginal product of the last unit of labor employed is <math alttext="500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>; the marginal product of the last unit of machinery (or capital) is <math alttext="1000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The unit price of labor is <math alttext="$10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the unit price of machinery or capital is <math alttext="$100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. With competitive input markets, which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The firm is minimizing the cost of producing <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> widgets with this combination of labor and capital.

The marginal product of labor is <math alttext="500" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the marginal product of capital is <math alttext="1000" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, so the firm is employing too much labor and too few machines to produce the <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> widgets.

The marginal product per dollar of labor exceeds the marginal product per dollar of machinery, so more labor and less capital should be used to produce the <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> widgets.
The firm should lower the price of machinery so that it is equal to the price of labor.
The firm is producing the given quantity inefficiently and should shut down.

content.answer: The marginal product per dollar of labor exceeds the marginal product per dollar of machinery, so more labor and less capital should be used to produce the <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> widgets.
